Description: Body sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery chalice; pale slip; interior glazed black; from top, parts of verticals in added white; two narrow white bands above wide red band; below, lotus buds in red and white; two bands in white and one in red; exterior: chequer pattern.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

For parallels regarding the chequered pattern, see British Museum 1924, 1201.369 and Cambridge Fitzwilliam GR.89.1894. The interior decoration is different on all three sherds and therefore they are unlikely to be from the same vessel. See also the prostyle building on the Troilos chalice from Pitane (Lemos 1991, 104-5, fig. 58).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 281, no. 780, pl. 102)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0855) (phase 2)
